entry.title: Gita Sarabhai (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Gita Sarabhai was among the first women to play the pakhavaj (example pictured), a traditional musical instrument of India?

entry.title: Erasmus Schöfer (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Erasmus Schöfer chronicled the resistance in Germany, from the protests of 1968 to German reunification, in a tetralogy of novels?

entry.title: Evangeline (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the film Evangeline, based on a poem by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow, was praised by Longfellow's daughter?

entry.title: a Miami TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the defiant owner of a Miami TV station kept its marquee lit for 18 months after losing its license?

entry.title: Carver Court (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Carver Court in Coatesville, Pennsylvania, was built to house African-American steelworkers during World War II?

entry.title: flag of Saint Helena (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the wirebird on the flag of Saint Helena is the last species of bird that is endemic to the island?

entry.title: W. P. Mahoney (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Arizona state senator W. P. Mahoney became an acquaintance of Wyatt Earp when he was a miner?

entry.title: smash or pass (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that some TikTokers make videos about whether to smash or pass Disney characters?
